basics.name: Kellan Cerveny
basics.label: Electrical and Computer Engineer
basics.summary: Engineer, entrepreneur, and tinkerer based in Austin, Texas.

education.institution: The University of Texas at Austin

work.name: Chevron
highlights: Provisioned IaaS and PaaS applications on MS Azure for the ServiceNow initiative through Ansible playbooks and implemented a DSC framework for automated monitoring
Developed a comprehensive dashboard for tracking critical roles in the CI/CD pipeline, optimizing build and deployment process for enhanced system reliability.

work.name: Oversimplified Tech
work.summary: The summer COVID-19 broke out, [Amin Hamidi](https://www.linkedin.com/in/amin-hamidi-a02650157) and I developed a motion detecting light product from home.
highlights: Developed custom harware and firmware for novel lighting product
Reduced product cost by 50% and assembly time by 90%.

work.name: Texas Inventionworks
highlights: Engineered Machine Access Control authentication system for heavy machinery, with a pending patent.
Achieved a 33% under-budget deployment on AWS IoT with OTA updates, enabling direct connections from edge-compute devices to the AWS Amplify web-app. | MQTT, REST, AWS IoT Core

work.name: Furnisearch.com
highlights: Led strategic planning, technology development, and technical hiring for cloud-native furniture search platform with $150k budget, partnered with 20+ retailers, including Bed Bath & Beyond and Herman Miller.

Architected a serverless data analytics platform, handling over 1M concurrent product analyses with 99% uptime. Achieved 75% faster delivery of MVP benchmarks and exceeded performance targets in 8 weeks. | Python, Celery, Redis, AWS SQS, Docker
Developed a novel computer-vision analysis tool, resulting in a 32x increase in product attribute data yield while maintaining 97% accuracy. | OpenCV, PIL, SKImage, Python
Prototyped frontend MVP using React, Node.js, Next.js, MUI, and Redux on AWS Amplify in 7 weeks.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

projects.name: Custom Built 3D Printer + GCode Sender
projects.summary: Designed and built the case, control board, GCode sender and interface for a 3D printer, placing 2nd in ECE design competition.

projects.name: View More Projects
projects.summary: Browse more of my projects on my website!

awards.title: BSA Eagle Scout
awards.summary: Built bookshelves for the San Jose pediatrics waiting room, offering reading resources for 26,000 annual patient visits.
